Replies.Reply: pinprick the velvet-black sky that stretches over a vast sleeping jungle. A fingernail moon silvers the whispering canopy while gentle tendrils of steam rise.
protruding from his chest. As the sword is viciously protracted through the door, the Man meets the Teen's haunted eyes and whispers his last, desperate word...
Run!
ECHOES as something otherworldly catches his scent and begins thrashing in pursuit. The Teen's face tightens with dread and the SHOUTS of his pursuers hammer his ears.
wraps around his throat. He is effortlessly hoisted by a TOWERING MAN with skin as cold and pale as alabaster.
Daniel, what's wrong? Did you break your ankle?
Oh my God.
sits at the end. It's cake-frosting pink and is built right on the edge of a coral-white beach.
Number 3 is dead.
-- we burn. I know the drill.
This is the part I hate the most.
We are hiding from the Mogadorians.
Only nine children escaped the genocide. We were each given a number and sent here to hide. I don't know where the others are. I only know when one of them is murdered.
Because of the spell our Elders cast, the Mogs can only kill us in order. That's the reason I've survived this long. But our enemy is relentless.
I didn't even get a chance to say goodbye.
Just when I think you can't get any less original, you lower the bar.
Did anybody else see this?
Taillights in five minutes. What we can't carry --
Time to go.
Florida's clear. I sent a letter to the school and there's nothing in the papers.
New IDs.
I'm not interested in originality.
You got lulled into a false sense of security. That's my fault.
I wish that you could have a normal life -- but you can't.
That's exactly what Number 3 did.
It's from an African news site. A man and his son went missing two nights ago. The locals think they were taken by strange beasts.
The Mogadorians are natural-born hunters. Blending in is our best protection.
Until I say otherwise -- yes.
You are.
Like it or not, it's your home too.
Cheer up, you're going to be living in Paradise.
What's your name?
Where are you from, John?
Why did you move to Paradise?
It's perfect.
Don't you worry about it.
I need a new photo first.
Say Paradise.
I've imputed the new search words: Daniel Jones. Big Pine Key.
If there's a story or picture of you on the internet, this program will find it. Our enemy doesn't know who you are -- I want to keep it that way.
I found our intruder -- he's a little small for a Mogadorian.
Must have been dumped.
What are you going to call him?
This one has five days of rations, spare clothes, cash and a handheld GPS. Keep it with you at all times.
Game's changed. You're in the crosshairs now. You have to be ready to leave at a moment's notice. With or without me.
Let's keep this our little secret.
Calm down. You're going to be okay.
Yours.
I need to get you out of here.
Your first Legacy is starting to manifest.
An extraordinary ability. Yours is called Lumen. They start a lot sooner on Lorien. I was beginning to fear yours would never emerge.
I didn't want to worry you. You were already under enough pressure.
I'm sorry.
This couldn't be opened until your first Legacy appeared. Ready?
Open it.
Crystals from Lorien's core.
Place your hand over them.
Our solar system.
That's what Lorien looked like thousands of years ago. We had all the problems that Earth has today.
Only a select few developed these abilities. They became known as the Garde.
Like your parents and grandparents.
They're Garde as well. Once you've mastered your Legacies, we'll find them and face the Mogadorians together.
I don't have any and never will.
Trust me.
You feel that?
When we're done, your entire body will be shielded against fire.
You'll get other Legacies too.
You don't get to pick them off a menu.
Mogs don't knock.
It's a girl.
Everything okay?
I think you should stay home from school for a couple of days.
Just to be safe.
Wasn't that your friend from the other night?
Principal called. Said there was an incident.
You're stronger and faster because of Earth's gravity -- you shouldn't use that advantage to settle petty scores.
You can't risk everything over wounded pride.
Article says it was arson.
They can track us anywhere. I think it's time you saw what you're really up against.
Your life is my life now. I will always protect you.
A lot of Lorics sacrificed their lives so that you could live.
The Elders had a plan. You weren't on that ship by chance. The nine of you were chosen for a reason.

I never thought we'd get off Lorien alive -- but we did. I didn't know how we could survive on a strange planet -- but we have. I gave us six months before the Mogs found us -- it's been 10 years. Don't give up now.
You have the potential to do great things. Even if you don't see it --
Because your life is my life. If you quit, then everything I've worked for and sacrificed is meaningless.
Remember -- nothing is inevitable.
No... go.
You've had enough for one day.
I heard on the police scanner that eight boys were beaten up in the woods tonight.
That was a stupid thing to do.
Telekinesis. That's a big step.
I need to teach you how to control these abilities. We'll start working on that tomorrow.
We got a hit on one of the search words.
Looks like a cell phone camera.
Working on it.
This isn't your fault. There's still nothing to trace us here.
This could take all night. Get some sleep.
I wasn't the only who was up last night.
I've tried every trick I know, but I can't crack that blog's firewall.
We need to find where the site's located and take it offline manually. The URL source has been run through a labyrinth of servers, it could take weeks to track down.
You can. Get changed.
I've found the --
You're clearly putting a lot of effort into it.
I finally tracked the location of that blog. It's a house in Warsaw, Indiana. About four hours from here. I'm heading up there tomorrow.
Send my regrets.
I won't risk taking you. I'll leave early and be back by five.
How could I? I have you.
We aren't like humans. Once we fall in love, it's for life. The pain of separation is unbearable.
Anastasia.
You're not responsible for what happened to her -- they are.
I looked at her the way you look at Sarah.
She can't come with us when we leave -- and we always have to leave, you know that.
I was hoping to protect you from that pain.
You shouldn't be here.
I talked my way in. Thought the big guy was buying it.
I was asking him about the video when the other one shot me from behind... some sort of animal tranq.
I'm getting rusty.
The Mogadorians... they've been here?
We need to go! Now!
Start the engine.
Yes, you can.
We're not going back to Paradise.
Thank you for your help, but you'll never see us again.
We leave at nightfall.
It's only a matter of time. They know our faces. They saw Sam. How long has he known?
I trusted you and you lied to me!
Now we don't have a choice. The Mogs are using humans to trap us.
This isn't a discussion.
Let. Me. Down.
Give me your phone and IDs.
John Smith dies today.
Taillights in five.
John?
John's not at the house. Is he here?
I know.
Go back inside. This isn't your fight.
Where are you?
Get out now!
He's telling us to run!
Bernie's a Chimera. He came with us from Lorien.
Somebody had to watch you when I wasn't around.
Right behind us.
You know how to use one of these?

nobly shoves John out of the way and is plucked into the Piken's jaws. The creature shakes him like a rag doll and flings him 50 feet down the field. John watches, anguished, as Henri lands in a heap.
I won't be coming with you this time. Save yourself.
Find the others.
Your life is my life... always.
skitters across the ceiling, its glossy black eyes watch as Daniel frantically stuffs his clothes into a duffel bag. The walls are bare. No photos, no posters, no personality.
It's been so long since the last scar.
I liked Florida. I liked having friends. I liked feeling normal.
Then why fake it? Why not just go hole up in the wilderness.
Piken.
So we just keep moving from town to town?
I want to be from someplace, Henri.
Lorien's your home, I don't even remember it.
I want a say in where we live.
You already picked it, didn't you?
She looks even perkier than the realtor in Florida.
John Smith.
Arizona.
Because you're an asshole.
Because my dad needs peace and quiet to research his book.
That's one word for it.
This guy was covering a hole in my wall.
That's the last of them. I'm hitting the sack.
Yeah, this place sucks.
Sand Dollar Beach, that's where we were jet skiing.
He's starving, doesn't have any collar or tags.
You know, another pair of eyes and ears watching the house wouldn't be a bad thing.
Since I need all the luck I can get -- how about Bernie Kosar?
Wow. You outdid yourself. What's up?
I already have a backpack.
Henri, come on.
Bernie, what the hell... were you hiding in the car?
He's not supposed to be here.
Go home. Now.
Sorry about your shot.
Someplace warmer.
I need to register.
Whoa. What are you doing?
Please don't point that at me.
What's your problem? I said no.
I'm not big into having my picture taken. Sorry.
Didn't know I was on it.
She was talking to me.
Maybe I'll fire back next time.
You sound like my dad.
Thanks for the download.
It was an accident.
Fine.
Line starts back there.
Where's that posted?
In that case, I guess I better ask you where I should sit. I was thinking about grabbing that chair next to your girlfriend.
Henri, what's happening to me?
On what planet is this okay?
Okay, start talking. What the hell's going on?
Legacy?
You knew this was going to happen?
What else have you been hiding from me?
Whoa.
What are they?
That's what I am?
The other children in the ship...
What Legacy do you have?
Ouch.
Flying would be cool.
Do what?
I don't know what you're talking about.
No.
I don't know what happened. Maybe it's a sign that you should invest in a digital camera.
She was returning my backpack.
I'm fine.
I'm going for a run.
Sorry, buddy, you couldn't keep up.
Wanted to apologize.
John.
You know all these people?
Not very interesting.
You first.
Your secret's safe with me.
Every single day.
I'm going to take off.
Wasn't feeling well.

has his door halfway open and ducks back a second before the ink pack planted in his locker ERUPTS. The spray misses his face but violently spits across his chest and arms. LAUGHTER echoes behind them. John spins and finds Mark and his posse.
That sensation you're feeling --
Show's over.
Who's in the picture?
Sounds like a fun vacation.
I'll live.
Why are you telling me?
You made the right call.
I saw the banners.
Her name's Sarah.
I didn't ask for a ride home.
A guy was messing with me. I took care of it. Problem solved.
It was no big deal. Don't blow it out of proportion.
I wasn't looking for a fight. It just happened. Get off my back.
We were clean. There's no way the Mogs can track us here.
Nooooooooooo!
I saw my grandfather. I saw what you did to the Mogadorians -- you saved my life.
He said I must survive.
You saw what they did to Lorien.
How can you put so much faith in me?
It's Sarah. The Block Party's tonight. I'll say I can't make it.
You work here?
What about your stepdad?
They should pull out all the stops next year.
Definitely unique.
I'm glad you broke free.
I'm trembling on the inside.
What was that?
Are you sure?
Sarah! Sa-
SARAH!
Where's Sarah? Tell me!!
Back off!
They got spooked.
I'm not mad at you. I'm mad at myself.
The guy's in love with you. Wants you back.
For this? Wouldn't waste their time.
You can.
Wait.
I better go.
They won't talk.
They attacked me. If I hadn't defended myself, I'd be in the ER right now. Would that have been the better choice?
You've got to start trusting me!
I was getting to that. I got a new Legacy.
What is it?
That's Sand Dollar Beach.
Can you take it down?
I'm sorry, Henri.
blur ACROSS THE FRAME of one of the surveillance camera screens and disappear into the woods.
I don't know what you think happened tonight...
What do you want from me?
I'm a survivor from a planet called Lorien.
Henri's not my dad. He's my Guardian. If he found out you knew about us, we'd be gone by morning.
I don't want to leave Paradise.
That doesn't prove anything.
You going to be okay?
You look wiped.
Sarah texted me. I went over to her house.
There must be a way.
I want to help.
They died.
It was a long time ago. It's just me and my dad now.
It takes him a while to warm up to people.
I don't know. Are there going to be a lot of people?
Just giving Bernie a quick bath.
Sarah invited us to Thanksgiving.
You shouldn't go alone. It could be dangerous.
Don't you ever get lonely?
You know what I mean. All these years, there's never been anyone.
What was her name?
You left her to save me.
You can't protect me from everything.
Just taking it all in.
It's okay. Let her take it.
I need to check in with Henri.
Henri?
Henri?
Who are you? Where's Henri?
I need your help.
It's Henri. I have to go. Sorry.
Thanks. I owe you.
Death scars.
Abduct people? No.
They're capable of anything.
We need to get to Warsaw -- now.
He would have parked it across town.
I called you because I needed a ride, not a sidekick. If I could have run here, I would have.
Go home. I'll call you when I get back.
I told you to go!
Henri's here.
Telekinesis -- but that's a work in progress.
Sam, we drove here.
New plan -- follow Lucky Strike.
Henri!
Your life is my life, remember?
We have to leave!
Henri!
He came to help.
Tell me what you know!
Start talking!
Did you?
Sam, get us out of here!
I can't.
DRIVE!
We'll meet you back at the house.
Nothing. Forget about us. We never existed.
Goodbye, Sam.
Henri, this is insane. They still don't know where we live.
Since Halloween.
Only because I knew how you'd react and I didn't want to leave Paradise.
No.
I'm not leaving without saying goodbye to Sarah.
I need to talk to Sarah.
She's special to me too.
Where's Sarah?
I'm sorry about last night.
I couldn't leave without seeing you one last time.
We're going to be fine.
The truth is I'm not who you think I am. You need to forget about me.
Because it's the only way to keep you safe.
Goodbye, Sarah.
Call 911!
Sarah!
Where's Sarah?
Don't let go of him. I promise I won't let go of you.
You okay?
I'll explain everything... but not here...
Sarah... please?
Please don't look at me like that.
It is for me.
I shouldn't be telling you any of this. It's dangerous.
I want that too. But if I stay you could get hurt. I have to leave to keep you safe.
High school.
Too late... they're here.
Who the hell are you?
On his way. Where's yours?
Tracking them?
The war starts tonight.
What are we up against?
It'll take us out to the stadium.
You got any other Legacies?
Lumen and telekinesis.
He's not dying because of me!
Mark! Linoleum! Now!
This isn't your fault -- it's mine.
Bernie!
Guess I wasn't the only one keeping secrets.

sees two Mogadorian Soldiers hauling heavy-duty weapons that use the glass cartridges that glow on their ammo belts. One FIRES another round. John telekinetically RIPS a door off its hinges. It flies forward, blocks the charge and IGNITES.
Go! Go! Go!
We're not leaving without my friends.
We stay and fight.
Save it for the Mogs. Let's go!
The door's over here. The tunnel leads out to the stadium.
Get her down the tunnel!
Don't stop! Get to the woods!
Nooooooooooooooooooooooooo!
Henri.
Come on, taillights in five.
We go together!
Nothing is inevitable.
You good to go?
Sam, ride with Six.
You need to stay here.
You could have died last night.
I'll come back for you.
When it's safe.
Where I'm from, we only give our heart to one person. I've given mine to you.
I love you, Sarah.
This is the first town I've left without Henri. The first one I have a reason to come back to.
He warned me the pain would be unbearable if I left her. He was right.
But I don't regret it. The pain reminds me what's at stake.
We must find the others and face our enemy together. I'm not sure how we can stop them. But nothing is inevitable. I know that now.
Here we are. Home sweet home.
First impressions?
I feel your pain. I have a daughter his age. Apparently, I ruin her life on a daily basis.
I told the handyman to patch that before you arrived. I'm so sorry.
We'll knock it off the rent. Keep the poster, Bernie Kosar brings good luck here in the Buckeye State.
Don't mind me.
Let's get a picture of you two lovebirds.
Little late for dessert.
She's not here. Some friends dragged her to a party at Mark Jayne's.
I don't usually pry into my daughter's love life, I certainly didn't want my mother in mine --
slips between Henri's legs. It cocks its head, studies John's face, then pads forward and licks his cheek.
Hey, I was about to take a picture of the little guy.
He's really well-trained. How long have you had him?
No worries.
You just moved into the house on Old Mill Road. It's John, right?
Don't worry, I'm not stalking you.
Where are you from?
I don't think that qualifies as an actual answer.
Capturing your first day, even though you're technically six weeks late.
Afraid the camera's going to steal your soul?
It's only for the yearbook.
How'd you do it?
Eviscerate the entire senior class?
I was in the darkroom before lunch and they were hanging on the line smiling and looking forward to the future. When I got back, I found 15 rolls of negatives wiped clean.
So you weren't in the darkroom today?
Here's a tip. If you're going to lie, don't leave a big red backpack at the scene of the crime.
Digital sucks. Film tells the truth. Clearly, I'm not going to get that from you.
disappearing into a room at the end. He's torn, then makes a decision and does something he shouldn't -- he strides down the hall after her.
I think you have the wrong room.
Does the apology come with an explanation?
Wait.
How about we delete Monday and start over?
I'm Sarah.
Nice gloves.
Curse of a small town. I've been around them my whole life.
Kim Thomas. She peed in her bed at a sleepover when we were seven.
Neil Bailey. President of the Debate Club. Plays five instruments. Doesn't know he's gay yet.
Mrs. Ross. AP English. She's been here so long, she taught my mom and my four brothers. I'm the baby of the family in case you were wondering.
So what's your story?
Determined to keep the mystery alive, aren't you?
Okay. Recovering cheerleader.
You ever feel you don't belong in your own life?
Wow. That almost sounded like a straight answer.
I thought you were on two-a-days.
John was helping me move some boards.
I don't have time for this, Mark.
You were following me?
You've crossed so many lines I can't even speak to you right now.
John.
I heard about the lockers. I'm sorry.
I broke up with Mark.
I've been thinking about doing it for a while... today just finally pushed me over the edge.
I don't know.
Halloween Block Party's tonight.
I'll be on Main Street hiding behind my camera if you want to swing by.
I wasn't expecting an actual response. I could text you later.
You made it.
What do you think of Halloween in Paradise?
Well, you haven't had the full experience until you've been on the Haunted Hayride.
Give me a sec.
You guys ready?
Sam's cool.
I haven't really talked to him since 8th grade. Mark had a tight circle. If you weren't a jock or cheerleader, you didn't exist.
Me too.
Not even a flinch. None of this scares you, does it?
You can smile. I was starting to have my doubts.
Once we make it through, we're home free.
That was insane.
Just part of the ride.
Let go! Stop it!
Let go of me!
Help! Somebody!
Are you crazy! Where's John?
I swear if you hurt him --
Get out of my face, Mark, you're pathetic.
John! Are you okay?
John! Stop!
That's his throwing arm!
Football's all he's got.
John! Wait.
I'm sorry, I didn't want you to break his arm.
I had no idea Mark would pull something like that. He has seriously gone off the deep end.
That's not love.
Walk me home?
This is me.
I know. Wait until the Christmas decorations go up. My mom decks the halls with so many lights, you can see our house from space.
You should see a doctor.
You're not going to tell me how you took out those football players, are you?
I really don't get you.
But I feel like I can trust you.
Good night.
I don't see any family pictures around. I guess the photo aversion is hereditary.
Your mom... grandparents. Is there anyone else in your life?
I'm sorry.
I get the feeling he doesn't like me very much.
Thanksgiving's tomorrow. Why don't you bring your dad and celebrate with us?
A tsunami of relatives. But don't worry, I'll shield you from the wave. Besides, I want everyone to meet you.
I better hit the road.
See you tomorrow. Twoish.
Bye, Mr. Smith.
Come on, we're on gravy-boat duty.
You look dazed.
I'm glad you came.
Mom. No. John really doesn't like having his --
I'll see what's taking him so long.
John!
Where is he, Sam?
What happened last night? I've tried calling him all day. But his number's no longer in service.
I'm not going anywhere until you tell me what's going on.
John!
No. Not good enough. Sam said you were never coming back. What are you doing here?
So it's true. What's going on?
Damnit! Whatever it is, I'll understand -- just tell me the truth.
Why are you acting like this?
Safe from what?
John!
Dozer's under the bed. He's too scared to come out!
You walked through that fire without getting burned. I saw you stop that beam.
I'm sorry. I'm still trying to process everything I saw and I keep coming to the same conclusion --
Who are you?
For once please tell me the truth.
I don't care. I just want to be with you.
There's something I want to give you first.
So you'll always remember me.
Hello.
It's Henri.
The gym, there's a tunnel under the stage.
We're invisible.
What are you doing with them?
The gym's this way.
Where's John?
Oh my God... John.
John!
John!
Sorry, Girl Scout first aid didn't cover extraterrestrial dagger wounds.
I want to come too.
Why?
I don't want to say goodbye.
When?

viciously sideswipes him. The textbooks scatter across the checkerboard linoleum. John sees the culprit is Mark Jayne, who offers him a taunting grin. John fights his urge to react and watches as Mark struts over to his POSSE OF JOCKS.
Welcome to Paradise, irony not included.
His name's Mark Jayne.
Do yourself a favor -- stay off his radar.
You were talking to Sarah Harte.
Mark and Sarah have been exclusive since Freshmen year.
If there's another guy in her airspace, he shoots them down. You got a warning shot.

Look, you're new, so let me tell you how things work in this misnamed backwater. Football players are gods -- the rest of us are mere mortals. If you want to survive, keep your head down and don't make waves.
Obviously a wise man.
I'm Sam by the way.
First day here and you're already destroying school property. So much for not making waves.
I hear the real spectator sport was Mark and Sarah's blowout.
Dude, you okay?
Dude, hold up!
You look like crap. I'll get the nurse.
Nice freakout the other day.
Assholes.
I raided lost and found.
I know. Nobody loses anything cool.
Dude, the way you thrashed Mark back there. Awesome move.
My dad. My real dad. I took it the summer before he split.
He dragged me and my mom all over the Yucatan. He was looking for evidence of ancient astronauts.
I know. Insane. He called himself an anthropologist even though he only made it through one semester of college.
Always thought he'd come back one day -- who was I kidding. The guy's a joke.
Not by choice.
Ed's my stepdad. He's under the delusion that if people eat enough candy apples and kettle corn, they'll suddenly have the urge to buy sporting goods.
I put those on special tonight for any wannabe Jason Voorhees.
Screw this. Let me lock up. I'll hang with you.
treat at my house.
She's over there.
Guidance Counsellor said I need to set goals for myself. Figured I'd aim high.
I'm impressed.
Three on a wagon might get a little crowded. I'll meet you two on the other side.
Sarah?
I've narrowed it down to three possibilities: you're a genetic experiment, you're a freak of nature, or you're an extraterrestrial.
Your hands lit up like a firefly on crack, you tossed those football players around like crash test dummies, and you took off faster than an Olympic runner.
Did I leave anything out?
I just want to know who you are.
Your dad... he's from there too?
I won't tell anyone.
There's something I want to show you.

The cops found it abandoned in the middle of Route 20, just south of White Sands, New Mexico. It was my dad's. He went missing six years ago. He was on one of his crazy fact-finding trips. He believed we weren't alone in the universe.
Mom figured he was having an affair and took off. All these years I thought she was right. Now you're here.
It proves he wasn't crazy. I'm starting to think that he didn't bail on us... that maybe something else happened out there -- that he was taken.
Guess the bar closed.
If he finds you here, it'll be worse.
Go.
Anything to get out of Thanksgiving at my house.
I checked out that blog on the way over. Saw the video. What was the deal with your ankle?
They kind of look like the symbols in my dad's research.
You guys don't --
How about the ones you said were hunting you?
I don't see his SUV anywhere.
Stole it from Ed.
Let's move.
See anything?
They might know where my dad is!
Wait! Other than strength, speed and night-light, what powers have you got?
No invisibility, X-ray vision, flight?
Okay. I'm ready. Let's do it.
Hurry up. Hurry up. Hurry up.
You just dead bolted it! Way to go!
I must have dropped the keys!
Hurry up!
Is he serious?
What am I supposed to tell people?
I don't know.
Forget about him, Sarah.
He left with Henri and he isn't coming back. Ever.
I'm sorry.
No, but he's all over the internet.
Those things from Warsaw -- they're coming, aren't they?
The hell it isn't. I'm coming with you.
What is it, boy?
I play a lot of Xbox.
I have to find out if the Mogs took my dad.
Alright, people. Let's hit the gym.
Okay, half court, three on three.
New kid, you're up. Show me what you've got.
Enough! Hit the showers.
LeBron, grab a broom.
You got a problem?
Football players get priority.
Unwritten rule.
If you don't know your place around here, things can get rough.
You want to talk trash? Let's see you back it up.
Get up!
What's he doing in here?
Coach wants me to rest my arm before the scouts come. You didn't answer my question?
Seriously, Sarah, what's up with this guy?
But you had time to go to his house the other night.
Just trying to figure out what's going on with you.
This isn't over.
Told you it wasn't over.
Relax. It's a practical joke.
Why do you give a shit?
I'm the best thing that ever happened to you and I'm giving you one more chance.
Don't walk away from me!
Where the hell are Kevin and Joe?
Hey, those are police property!
I'm going to kill you!
You weren't invited.
She doesn't want to see you.
It's too late. You can't get through!
Where are we going? Is this about the fire? It was an accident.
Yeah, John Smith. But I didn't invite him.
I'll help you find him.
He's not at Sarah's, I already checked. And one of my dad's deputies drove by his house --
I've got Sarah's cell number, maybe you guys can trace it?
What the hell's in there?
You guys aren't FBI.
They said they were FBI. That John was a fugitive. What the hell's going on?
I didn't know they were trying to kill you.
I'm sorry.
My dad's the sheriff.
The Sheriff's Department is starting to put up roadblocks. You guys better get moving.
blooming from his palms! He quickly balls them into fists, extinguishing the light from view.
is behind the wheel and watches as her headlights fade into the night. OFF his simmering jealousy...
eclipsing Lorien's two moons. The angular hulls of the craft are scarred from galactic battles new and ancient and unleash an endless crisscrossing FRENZY OF MISSILES.
Keep moving.
This is your Cepan. Go with him.
He must survive.
They are already hunting you! Go!
No!
Nooooooooooo!
hunkered behind a column, his red coat billows behind him like a curse.

suddenly swoops between them. The HOWLS of its occupants ricochet through the night. The heat from its engines washes the ground, warping the destruction like a ghastly mirage as two bay doors open. Young John looks back through the heat-
drop from the trees. Sarah freaks as the arachnids dangle over their heads on wires. She rubs her hair, flustered, looks over at John, who is coolly amused by the cheap scares.

burst through the gates behind them. The teens take off.
cuts through the dark and viciously SMACKS John on the back.

trudge into view. Sam darts behind a tree. Suddenly, the area is flooded with preternatural white light. He can hear the sounds of a SCUFFLE and one of the Jocks flies past and CRASHES in a heap while the other SCREAMS.
You're blinding me! Stop!
Shepherd Falls. Now turn off that damn flashlight!
Everybody upstairs! Kevin's going for the beer bong record!
Sam! Where are you?
You think I wouldn't hear you locked up early!
Are you one of them too?
THE KITCHEN PORCH.
the padlock securing the chains, and rips off the gag.
head down them into view. Frank holds the revolver against Sam's neck. Their shadows crisscross under the swaying bulb.
Stay planted or I'll blow your friend's head off.
You're the one from the video!
I don't know what they're called.
He told me to call if anyone came asking about the video.
They wanted me to hold your friend until they got here.
I called you like I said. It's not my fault they got away!
How should I know? The kid had me pinned to the ceiling.
lurches into the mouth of the tunnel. Without a second's hesitation, Sam swings up his gun and BLASTS it. Mark looks at him in shock as they race through the embers. Sam shrugs.
Where did they go?
Where did they go?
We're hunting for one of the guests at your party.
Do you know this boy?
He's a fugitive. We've been tracking him for some time.
He poses a great threat to us.
Tell me everything you know about John Smith.
Your Cepan saved you on Lorien.
But this moment was inevitable.
suddenly flower open across its surface and viciously spin.
The Chief wants to send the morgue boys in and seal this tomb.
Hope they haven't had lunch yet.
Who the hell are you?
How'd you get in?
Hey, we've got a live one down here.

appears in the corner of his viewfinder. She's kneeling by Frank's severed head which has rolled a short distance from the body. The Photographer pulls the camera away from his eye and looks at the Teen Girl, confused.

billowing from the side of the house. He bolts towards the front door, SCREAMS at a JOCK as he passes.

breaks free and swings down in front of them. Sarah SCREAMS, but watches in stunned amazement as John sweeps it out of the way with a telekinetic flick of his hand.

Characters.Character: A PHOTOGRAPH OF SARAH AND JOHN

Replies.Reply: sharpens INTO FOCUS. It's the one Annie took of them at Thanksgiving. John and Sarah stand in the eerie red glow.
The FBI showed up flashing their badges. Wanna talk to you.
over his broad shoulders. The cartridges are made of crystal and swirl with purple light. Finally, he slips on his trademark red coat and spins towards the school.
who was stalking up the hall behind them! John watches in shock as the Mogadorian keels over and SHATTERS into embers.
You oughta keep your heroics off the internet.
Dead. The Mogs got her four months ago. We had been tracking them.
We discovered they plan to attack Earth. The only thing standing in their way is the six of us.
You know what that means?
First we have to get out of here alive and find the others.
There's a commander, a bunch of soldiers and two Piken. They'll have all the main entrances covered.
I can control the elements. You?
Stay put. They want to draw you out.
Barricade the doors!
You've stumbled into a war. So shut up and keep your head down.
Keep moving!
They've blocked it. Use your telekinesis.
Don't you mean the girl?
I broke the Elders' spell to find you. The Mogs can kill me now. We have to go.
Saving your life. My new hobby.
Thanks.
Don't worry about me.
We don't need baggage.
You slow us down, I'll shoot you myself.
PUMMEL-RAMS through the wall in a shower of bricks, books and paper. It utters a glass-shattering ROAR. John looks back and sees Bernie bravely holding his ground.
steps out of the shadows. There is nowhere and no time for Henri and the others to run. But as the Mogadorian squeezes the trigger of his hand-cannon, the wall on his right  ERUPTS!
spring out of the dark. One tackles Henri while the other blindsides John. Henri struggles until  BOOOOOM!
that radiates across the field like a blinding ring of hell.
limps into view. Blood mats his fur and his face is scratched but he's alive. OFF John's relief...
